chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel Ceballos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: credit for 0 days time served concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
No contact with victims or any children under the age of 17 unless authorized by agent.

Court ordered the defendant participate in any treatment recommended by the DOC.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel Ceballos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (22 pages) GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING commencing 07-08-2015 received and filed.

Per Stipulation and Order signed on 9/30/2015:  State request the Court correct CCAP and the conviction to relfect a convictionfor sexual assault of a child under 13 years of age in volation of Wis. Stat 948.02(1); and strikce the handwritted paragraph "(e)" referenced in the amended information in 2015CF2083.
Stipulation and Order Regarding Docket and Amended Information GRANTED signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Maria C., Susan C.   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served concurrent to any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-No contact with victims or any children under the age of 17 unless authorized by agent
-Court ordered the defendant participate in any treatment recommended by the DOC
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Amended Information filed. Defendant is charged as follows First Degree Sexual Assault of a Child Under 13, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 948.02(1)(e), a Class B Felony.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Manuel Ceballos in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Atty Joyce contacts the court and requests plea/sentencing date.  Case set for 7-8-2015 at 8:15a.m  ADA Mathy agrees to date.  Defendant to be produced from HOC.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Manuel Ceballos in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
State's Motion for Joinder is argued by counsels.  The court rules that cases can be joined pursuant to 971.12(1).  Court orders cases 15CF643 and 15CF2083 joined for trial.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 Safety Building.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-7-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 8-19-2015 at 8:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 7-8-2015.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
TOT Justicepoint with GPS monitoring and 24 hour curfew.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Manuel Ceballos in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for Josh Mathy for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Defense objects to motion for joinder with 15CF643 at this time but does but does not object to adjournment of jury trial set for 6-8-2015.  The court will convert the trial date to motion date and a new trial will be set when ADA Mathy is present.
Defense motion to modify bail is argued and granted.  The court will modify bail to $10,000 cash TOT Justicepoint with GPS monitoring.  24 hour curfew and no contact order to remain in place.
State's Motion to Consolidate Cases and Adjourn Trial, received and filed.

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Defendant Manuel Ceballos in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Dawn Maldonado.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jolene Reyes-MPD Officer.  Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of "MEC" as to COUNT 1 on page 1.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Filed, NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL.
css
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MEC; Angel C.; Carmen C.; Aunt Olga (witness); Aunt Blanca (witness); Aunt Susan C. (witness); Uncle Homer C (witness)/

TRAVEL RESTRICTION:  NO TRAVEL OUTSIDE WISCONSIN/NO DEPARTURE FROM UNITED STATES ABSENT FEDERAL AUTHORITY

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.   Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Defendant Manuel Ceballos in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Manuel Ceballos in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Liesl Monroy
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
